textBody:
Lithium citrate (Li3C6H5O7) is a chemical compound of lithium and citrate that is used as a mood stabilizer in psychiatric treatment of manic states and bipolar disorder[http://www.medbroadcast.com/drug/getdrug/pms-lithium-citrate Medication description][http://www.nami.org/Template.cfm?SectionAbout_Medications&Template
/TaggedPage/TaggedPageDisplay.cfm&TPLID51&ContentID
20820 Medical use] . There is extensive pharmacology of lithium, the active component of this salt.

Lithia water contains various lithium salts, including the citrate. An early version of Coca-Cola available in pharmacies' soda fountains called Lithia Coke was a mixture of Coca-Cola syrup and lithia water. The soft drink 7Up was originally named "Bib-Label Lithiated Lemon-Lime Soda" when it was formulated in 1929 because it contained lithium citrate. The beverage was a patent medicine marketed as a cure for hangover. Lithium citrate was removed from 7Up in 1948.
